publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1900# Margaret Mitchell: Deafblindness—That the Parliament recognises the European Parliament Declaration of Rights of Deafblind people which was formally adopted on 1 April 2004 and recognises deafblindness as a distinct disability separate from hearing or sight impairment; considers that more should be done to identify, correctly assess and provide appropriate services for this unique group who cannot automatically benefit from mainstream services or services for people who are either blind or deaf, and further considers that councils should make appropriate provision for this uniquely disadvantaged group, ensuring that they have the same provision of services as outlined in the guidance issued under section 7(1) of the Local Authority Social Services Act 1970 for England and Wales.

S2M-1900# Deafblindness (lodged on 27 October 2004) Alex Neil*, Mr David Davidson*, Murray Tosh*, Fergus Ewing*, Mary Scanlon*, Chris Ballance*, Donald Gorrie*, David McLetchie*, Robert Brown*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*

S2M-1900# Margaret Mitchell: Deafblindness—That the Parliament recognises the European Parliament Declaration of Rights of Deafblind people which was formally adopted on 1 April 2004 and recognises deafblindness as a distinct disability separate from hearing or sight impairment; considers that more should be done to identify, correctly assess and provide appropriate services for this unique group who cannot automatically benefit from mainstream services or services for people who are either blind or deaf, and further considers that councils should make appropriate provision for this uniquely disadvantaged group, ensuring that they have the same provision of services as outlined in the guidance issued under section 7(1) of the Local Authority Social Services Act 1970 for England and Wales. Supported by: Alex Neil, Mr David Davidson, Murray Tosh, Fergus Ewing, Mary Scanlon, Chris Ballance, Donald Gorrie, David McLetchie, Robert Brown, Mrs Nanette Milne, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Phil Gallie*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Richard Lochhead*, Mike Pringle*, Linda Fabiani*, Eleanor Scott*, John Scott*, Shiona Baird*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*

S2M-1900# Margaret Mitchell: Deafblindness—That the Parliament recognises the European Parliament Declaration of Rights of Deafblind people which was formally adopted on 1 April 2004 and recognises deafblindness as a distinct disability separate from hearing or sight impairment; considers that more should be done to identify, correctly assess and provide appropriate services for this unique group who cannot automatically benefit from mainstream services or services for people who are either blind or deaf, and further considers that councils should make appropriate provision for this uniquely disadvantaged group, ensuring that they have the same provision of services as outlined in the guidance issued under section 7(1) of the Local Authority Social Services Act 1970 for England and Wales. Supported by: Alex Neil, Mr David Davidson, Murray Tosh, Fergus Ewing, Mary Scanlon, Chris Ballance, Donald Gorrie, David McLetchie, Robert Brown, Mrs Nanette Milne, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Phil Gallie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Richard Lochhead, Mike Pringle, Linda Fabiani, Eleanor Scott, John Scott, Shiona Baird, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Trish Godman, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper, Frances Curran, Dr Jean Turner, Cathy Peattie, John Swinburne, Alex Johnstone, Murdo Fraser, Bill Aitken, Christine Grahame, Bruce Crawford, Alex Fergusson, Carolyn Leckie, Mrs Margaret Ewing, John Farquhar Munro, Alasdair Morgan, Rosie Kane, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr Bruce McFee, Dennis Canavan, Tricia Marwick, Dr Elaine Murray, Kate Maclean, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Shona Robison, Jeremy Purvis, Elaine Smith, Irene Oldfather, Bristow Muldoon*, Miss Annabel Goldie* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
